author: Daniel Kruger
title: U.S. Dollar Gains 1.2% in February
text:
The U.S. dollar edged higher Wednesday, supported by increasing speculation that the Federal Reserve could raise interest rates four times this year.
The Wall Street Journal Dollar Index, which measures the currency against a basket of 16 others, rose 0.2% to 84.19. The dollar has advanced 1.8% since hitting a three-year low on Feb. 15, giving it a 1.2% gain for February. It was the indexâ€™s largest one-month advance since October.
